label: MT2759
info_overview:
This Z-Wave module is used for switching on or off the electrical device (e.g. light or fan). The module operates on 868,4 MHz. The module can be controlled either through Z-wave network or through the wall switch. The module is designed to be mounted inside a “flush mounting box”, hidden behind a traditional wall switch. Module measures power consumption of electrical device and supports connection of digital temperature sensor. It is designed to act as repeater in order to improve range and stability of Z-wave network.

Supported switches

Module supports mono stable switches (push button) and bi stable switches. The module is factory set to operate with bi stable switches.
info_inclusion:
Module Inclusion (Adding to Z-wave network)

  • Connect module to power supply (with temperature sensor connected if purchased*),
  • enable add/remove mode on main controller
  • auto inclusion (works for about 2 minutes after connected to power supply) or
  • press push button I1 three times within 5 s (3 times change switch state within 5 seconds) or
  • press service button S (only applicable for 24 V SELVsupply voltage) for more than 2 second


NOTE 1: For auto inclusion procedure, first set main controller into inclusion mode and then connect module to power supply.
NOTE 2: When connecting temperature sensor to module that has already been included, you have to exclude module first. Switch off power supply, connect the sensor and re include the module.
info_exclusion:
Module Exclusion/Reset (Removing from Z-Wave network)

  • Connect module to power supply
  • bring module within maximum 1 meter (3 feet) of the main controller,
  • enable add/remove mode on main controller
  • press push button I1 five times within 5 s (5 times change switch state within 5 seconds) in the first 60 seconds after the module is  connected to the power supply or
  • press service button S (only applicable for 24 V SELV supply voltage) for more than 6 seconds.

By this function all parameters of the module are set to default values and own ID is deleted.

Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.

If push button I1 is pressed three times within 5 s (or service button S is pressed more than 2 and less than 6 seconds) module is excluded, but configuration parameters are not set to default values.

NOTE: If the module is included with parameters 100 or 101 with values different to default and module reset is done, wait at least 30s before next inclusion.

      When relay is ON it goes automatically OFF after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive ON command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).<\/p>

      • default value 0<\/li>
      • 0 = Auto OFF disabled<\/li>

        • default value 0<\/li>
        • 0 Auto ON disabled<\/li>

          Set value means percentage, set value from 0 - 100 = 0% - 100%. Available configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):<\/p>

          • default value 10 = 10%<\/li>
          • 0 = reporting disabled<\/li>
          • 1-100 = 1% - 100% reporting enabled<\/li> <\/ul>

            Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts , step is When using low power loads, It is recommended to set parameter no. 40 to a higher value (e.g. 50%).<\/p>

            NOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set.<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 10, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 100, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "Reporting disabled" } ] }, { "id": 42, "label": "Power reporting (W) by time interval", "description": "Power reporting in Watts by time interval", "overview": "

            • default value 300 = 300s<\/li>
            • 0 reporting disabled<\/li>

              Enable \/ Disable Endpoint I2 or select Notification Type and Event<\/h1>

              Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value.               Endpoint device type selection:<\/h2>

              notification sensor (1-6):<\/p>

              GENERIC_TYPE_SENSOR_NOTIFICATION, SPECIFIC_TYPE_NOTIFICATION_SENSOR<\/p>

              1 \u2013100<\/td> From 1 to 100 value from 0.1\u00b0C to 10.0\u00b0C is added to actual measured temperature.<\/td> <\/tr>
              1001 \u20131100<\/td> From 1001 to 1100 value from 0.1 \u00b0C to 10.0 \u00b0C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.<\/td> <\/tr><\/table>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 32536, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 1, "value_max": 32536, "options": [] }, { "id": 120, "label": "Temperature sensor reporting", "description": "Temperature sensor reporting", "overview": "

category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: (I1) Input 1 switch type
parameters.overview:
Values Description
0 mono stable switch type (push button)
1 bi stable switch type (default)

parameters.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF
parameters.description: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
parameters.overview: HC Switch relay module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

options.label: NONE
options.overview: ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active

options.label: ALL OFF
options.overview: ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active

options.label: ALL ON
options.overview: ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

parameters.label: Automatic turning off
parameters.description: Automatic turning off output after set time
parameters.overview:
When relay is ON it goes automatically OFF after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive ON command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).

  • default value 0
  • 0 = Auto OFF disabled
  • 1 - 32535 = 1 second (0,01s) - 32535 seconds (325,35s)

Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr. 15.

parameters.label: Automatic turning on
parameters.description: Automatic turning on output after set time
parameters.overview:
When relay is OFF it goes automatically ON after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive OFF command regardless from where it come s (push button, associated module, controller,..).

Available configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte DEC):

  • default value 0
  • 0 Auto ON disabled
  • 1 32535 = 1second (0,01s) 32536 seconds (325,35s)

Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10m s according to parameter nr. 15.

parameters.label: Auto off / on, s or ms selection
parameters.description: Automatic turning off / on seconds or milliseconds selection
parameters.overview: NOTE: Parameter is the same for turning OFF or ON.

parameters.label: Saving the state
parameters.description: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure

options.label: HC Switch relay module saves its state
options.overview: HC Switch relay module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)

options.label: HC Switch relay module returns to "off" position
options.overview: HC Switch relay module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to "off" position.

parameters.label: Power reporting (W) on power change
parameters.description: Power reporting in Watts on power change
parameters.overview:
Set value means percentage, set value from 0 - 100 = 0% - 100%. Available configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):

  • default value 10 = 10%
  • 0 = reporting disabled
  • 1-100 = 1% - 100% reporting enabled

Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts , step is When using low power loads, It is recommended to set parameter no. 40 to a higher value (e.g. 50%).

NOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set.

parameters.label: Power reporting (W) by time interval
parameters.description: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
parameters.overview:
Set value means time interval (0 - 32535) in seconds, when power report is send. Available configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte DEC):

  • default value 300 = 300s
  • 0 reporting disabled
  • 30-32535 = 30 seconds - 32535 seconds. Reporting enabled.
    Power report is send with time interval set by entered value.

parameters.label: Output Switch selection
parameters.overview: Set value means the type of the device that is connected to the output. The device type can be normally open (NO) or normally close (NC).

options.label: (NC) output is 0V (default)
options.overview: When system is turned off the output is 0V (NC). (Default)

options.label: (NO) output is 230V / 24V
options.overview: When system is turned off the output is 230V or 24V (NO).

parameters.label: Enable / Disable Endpoint I2
parameters.description: Enable / Disable Endpoint I2 or select Notification Type and Event
parameters.overview:
Enable / Disable Endpoint I2 or select Notification Type and Event

Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Available configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):

Endpoint device type selection:

notification sensor (1-6):

GENERIC_TYPE_SENSOR_NOTIFICATION, SPECIFIC_TYPE_NOTIFICATION_SENSOR

Values Description
1 Home Security: Motion Detection, unknown loc. (Default)
2 Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
3 Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
4 Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown loc.
5 Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown loc.
6 Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown loc.
0 Endpoint I2 disabled

binary sensor (9):

GENERIC_TYPE_SENSOR_BINARY, SPECIFIC_TYPE_NOT_USED

NOTE 1 : After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s and then re include the module!

NOTE 2: If parameter is set to value 9, the messages will be sent to Home Security!

options.label: Carbon Monoxide
options.overview: Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.

options.label: Carbon Dioxide
options.overview: Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.

options.label: Water Alarm
options.overview: Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown loc.

parameters.label: Enable / Disable Endpoint I3
parameters.description: Enable / Disable Endpoint I3 or select Notification Type and Event
parameters.overview:
Enable / Disable Endpoint I3 or select Notification Type and Event

Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Available configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):

Endpoint device type selection:

notification sensor (1-6):

GENERIC_TYPE_SENSOR_NOTIFICATION, SPECIFIC_TYPE_NOTIFICATION_SENSOR

Values Description
1 Home Security: Motion Detection, unknown loc. (Default)
2 Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
3 Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
4 Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown loc.
5 Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown loc.
6 Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown loc.
0 Endpoint I3 disabled

binary sensor (9):

GENERIC_TYPE_SENSOR_BINARY, SPECIFIC_TYPE_NOT_USED

NOTE 1 : After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s and then re include the module!

NOTE 2: If parameter is set to value 9, the messages will be sent to Home Security!

options.label: Carbon Monoxide
options.overview: Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.

options.label: Carbon Dioxide
options.overview: Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.

options.label: Water Alarm
options.overview: Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown loc.

parameters.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
parameters.overview:
Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. Available configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte DEC):

Values Description
32536  is 0.0C (Default)
1 –100 From 1 to 100 value from 0.1°C to 10.0°C is added to actual measured temperature.
1001 –1100 From 1001 to 1100 value from 0.1 °C to 10.0 °C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.

parameters.label: Temperature sensor reporting
parameters.overview:
If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Available configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):

Values Description
5 0,5°C (default)
0 Reporting disabled
1 –127 0,1°C - 12,7°C, step is 0,1°C

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: Lifeline group (reserved for communication with the main controller), 1 node allowed.

associations.label: Basic On/Off I1
associations.description: basic on/off (triggered at change of the output Q state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.

associations.label: Basic On/Off I2
associations.description: basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.

associations.label: Reporting I2
associations.description: Notification report (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.

associations.label: Binary Sensor Report I2
associations.description: Binary sensor (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.

associations.label: Basic On/Off I3
associations.description: basic on/off (triggered at change of the input I3 state an d reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.

associations.label: Reporting I3
associations.description: notification report (triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.

associations.label: Binary Sensor Report I3
associations.description: binary sensor report (triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.

associations.label: Multi-Level Sensor Reporting
associations.description: multilevel sensor report (triggered at change of temperature sensor) up to 16 nodes.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
